definition: to hate out of jealousy/to resent

sentences.english: If a dog is gorgeous, other dogs don't h ate it.
sentences.chinese: 如果某隻狗打扮得很華麗，其它的狗也不會嫉恨。
種族間的嫉恨是一種不良的風氣。

sentences.english: What of the cripple who hates dancers?
Afterwards, Shun didn't resent and was still humble to his father and loved his younger brother.
sentences.chinese: 事後舜毫不嫉恨，仍對父親恭順，對弟弟慈愛。

sentences.english: Just don't hate her (too much) for being perfect.
sentences.chinese: 請千萬不要因爲她的完美而嫉恨她。

sentences.english: You don't let me lose that all the dignity, so I won't grudges you.
sentences.chinese: 你沒有讓我失去那全部的尊嚴，所以我不會嫉恨你。

sentences.english: Now here is a couple of seconds for you to resent me.
sentences.chinese: 現在你們還有幾秒鐘的時間來嫉恨我。

sentences.english: And, consequently, Mark was the best hated and most Calumniated man of his time.
sentences.chinese: 也正因爲如此，馬克思纔在自己所處的時代最遭嫉恨。

sentences.english: What if you're suffering some malaise and it's not just envy?
sentences.chinese: 如果你感到你的不快並不僅僅來自於嫉恨會怎麼辦？

sentences.english: Make your confidence work for you without going over the top and alienating coworkers.
sentences.chinese: 確保你自信的工作但也不會過了頭以致被同事嫉恨。

definition: to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
variant of 憤恨|愤恨[fen4 hen4]
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to be suspicious and jealous of
